channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024030398
item.description:
Report X-2024030398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Flammable liquid hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Alpha K751 extraction test solution 1-gallon had loose lids resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottles had loose lids resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030380
item.description:
Report X-2024030380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030380 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One jug in the box was leaking contents from a loose cap. The box and both jugs inside were also leaked on and soiled by a damaged box of paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2024030381 SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The jerrican was dropped onto a bolt on the floor, puncturing the bottom and causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jerrican was placed upside down, with the puncture on top, into a hazbag lined tote.

  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in damage area leaking contents onto ground on 2/21/2024 at 20:00. Once package was discovered, it was immediately placed in a hazmat bag and taken to the damage hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: Approx 2 inch hole at bottom of 5 gallon drum inside of fiberboard box. package appears to have been dropped during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside of a hazmat bag to prevent any further leaks onto warehouse floor.

item.title: Report I-2024030024
item.description:
Report I-2024030024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/15/2024, during the boarding phase of flight DL2019, a passenger's carry-on bag in the overhead bin went into thermal runaway. The Flight Attendants heard a"pop" and saw flames in the overhead bin at row 11. Flight Attendants initiated an evacuation using the jetway. Customer removed the bag from the overhead and stepped on it to extinguish the fire. The flight attendants were on their way to retrieve the containment bag/water. ARFF responded, determined multi loose Li-ion batteries and coins arched and started the fire. No fire extinguisher or 02 masks were used. The affected overhead bin has no damage other than smoke soot residue. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report X-2024030134
item.description:
Report X-2024030134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: FORT WALTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENT FOUND RECENTLY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A ONE GALLON JUG OF CORROSIVE CWB SOLUTIONS GOLD ASSASSIN RTU CONCRETE CLEANER/DEGREASER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024030163
item.description:
Report E-2024030163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Big Valley Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Williston, FL regarding the assistance with a (1) gallon spill of Sectagon K54 (UN3266,8,PG II). The product was released from a poly tote onto the trailer floor at a terminal. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Sectagon K54. Contractors were able to clean and neutralize the release with ABZORBIT PREMIUM ABSORBENT and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum which was taken off-site for proper disposal.

TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA USING THE HAZMAT PUSHCART. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP WHILE WEARING GOOGLES, BOOTS, ARPON AND GLOVES.

item.title: Report X-2024021784
item.description:
Report X-2024021784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived to station punctured and placed in hazmat been for further inspection. Upon inspection the bottom of the box was wet because 4 bottles of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing minimal leakage. The 4 bottles of Calci-Solve were tightly packed with no inner protection. DescribePack: 4 gallons of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing them to leak. There was minimal leakage between all 4 gallons of Calci-Solve. All bottles of are still completely full. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat bag and bin then placed in Hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021909
item.description:
Report X-2024021909

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: RIVIERA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUSPECTED SHIPMENT OF UNDECLARED HAZMAT (MISSING REQUIRED OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE). INSTRUCTED TO AUDIT AND HOLD AT HUB AT HUB PENDING INVESTIGATION. DAY TWO OF AUDIT FOUND APPROXIMATELY 252 PACKAGES CONTAINING VARIOUS AMMUNITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER PACKAGES. ADDITIONALLY, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WEIGHT ON EACH BOX IS 1 POUND, BUT THE ACTUAL WEIGHTS ARE MUCH GREATER THAN 1 POUND.

DescribePack: Package handler didn't use hand to surface which caused the package to fall to the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package inside a bag and then inside hazmat material tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021901
item.description:
Report X-2024021901

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: RIVIERA BEACH

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SUSPECTED SHIPMENT OF UNDECLARED HAZMAT (MISSING REQUIRED OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE). INSTRUCTED TO AUDIT AND HOLD AT HUB AT HUB PENDING INVESTIGATION. APPROXIMATELY 301 PACKAGES IN THREE PALLETS FOUND CONTAINING VARIOUS AMMUNITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE PACKAGES. PACKAGES SHIPPING FROM TOTAL GUN AMMUNITION (TGA) 1460 N JOG RD, WEST PALM BEACH FL 33411. RESPONDER DISCOVERED ADDITIONALLY, THE PACKAGE WEIGHT ON EACH BOX IS 1 POUND, BUT THE ACTUAL WEIGHTS ARE MUCH GREATER THAN 1 POUND, 11.5 POUNDS.
